segments.text: What happened ? Why didn't he win ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Didn't you hear ? He was disqualified .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: How did that happen ? He's so talented ! I thought he had a great chance of winning a gold medal !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: If he didn't have any drug problems , he would have won .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What ? What kind of drugs was he using ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: He was taking steroids to make him stronger and faster .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I thought that all athletes were supposed to be regularly tested for drugs .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: They are . The only reason they didn't disqualify him until after the race is because the results from the text only came back afterwards .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That's so disappointing . I don't know why top athletes would feel the need to take drugs .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I don't think it's right , but I can understand why they might . Imagine how much pressure there would be to win for your country !
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Regardless of how much pressure you're under , there's never a good reason to take drugs .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I agree . Hopefully with the new regulations , fewer athletes will try to cheat with drugs .
segments.speaker: S2
